root: ^Detective Shade. I’m investigating Evelyn Blake’s murder.
^Detectives, always so good at breaking and entering. Did the academy teach you to ignore doorbells, or is this a personal flair?
^The door was unlocked, and you didn’t respond. I was concerned.
^Concerned? Maybe start by locking the door on your way out next time. Now, make it quick. I don’t have time for your games.
^Don't worry, I’m... just here to ask a few questions.
^Questions. Of course. Because digging up non-existent dirt on me and Victor is a productive use of your time.
^Yes, Victor. We’re both trying to keep it together after Evelyn’s death, and you poking around isn’t helping. So, what is it this time?

option_1: ^Tell me about your relationship with Evelyn. You two worked closely together, didn’t you?
^We were business partners. She handled the art, I handled the logistics. It was a good balance. Not that it mattered in the end.
option_2: ^What kind of business ventures were you and Evelyn planning?
^Plenty. Evelyn was talented, and I made sure the world saw it. That’s what partners do. But now you’re here, turning all that into a spectacle.
option_3: ^Your apartment is striking. Mind if I take a quick photo for reference?
^Oh yeah? And why should I humor you?

c-0: ^This isn’t about invading your privacy, Marina. Sometimes photos help me see details I might miss in the moment. It’s purely for the investigation.
^You’re persistent, I’ll give you that. Fine. But don’t touch anything—or I’ll have you arrested for real.
c-1: ^You’ve done an incredible job with this place. It shows you’ve got an eye for detail
^Evelyn must’ve seen that too. A quick photo could help me piece things together.
^Hmph, fine. You get one shot Detective, but flattery can only get you so far.
c-2: ^Marina, if you have nothing to hide, then a photo shouldn’t be an issue. Or are you worried about what it might reveal?
^You’re unbelievable. Fine. But take your damn photo and leave.
c-3: ^You’re right. I don’t want to intrude further. I’ll respect your space.
^Good. Now respect my time too, Detective, and get out.
